prompt: You have recipe organizing software that lets you file recipes into your own categories, but you can only put recipes in one category. You already have categories for types of meals, like “Breakfasts” and “Vegetable Sides.” You’re thinking of adding a “Favorites” category to quickly find your favorite recipes. What’s a disadvantage of this idea?
feedback: Because the program only lets you put a recipe in one category, if you add a “Favorites” category, you won’t be able to include the recipes you put in “Favorites” in the other categories. If one of your favorite recipes is a Green Chile Omelette, you won’t be able to find it if you look under “Breakfasts.”
